info.title: Security Content
info.description:
Security content enables you to get, write or delete various security content. Depending on the kind of connection, the applied authorization and authentication options, and the direction of the request (either inbound or outbound), different kind of security content needs to be created and deployed on the tenant. You can manage the floowing security content types:
* User credentials
* OAuth2 client credentials
* Keystore entries
* Certificate-to-user mappings  
  
This API is implemented based on OData version 2 specification.
 If you like to request the OData API on your tenant, you need to know how to find out the address of the HTTP call. For more information, see [HTTP Calls and URL Components](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_INTEGRATION_SUITE/51ab953548be4459bfe8539ecaeee98d/ca75e12fc5904d96a038aef6c00db5fc.html).
 If you face problems using the API, you can create a ticket. Check out for the right support component on this page: [Support Components](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_INTEGRATION_SUITE/51ab953548be4459bfe8539ecaeee98d/bd2d883ae8ee4e2696038be7741d93d7.html).

externalDocs.description: SAP Integration Suite documentation: OData API - Security Content

x-sap-shortText: Access and manage security content to configure secure connections with remote systems.

x-servers.description: SAP Cloud Integration REST API Endpoint

Account Short Name.description: SAP BTP short name where Cloud Integration is provided

x-servers.description: SAP Cloud Integration Custom Domain Endpoint - see [Configuring Custom Domains](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/7230b9ff41914cc0969223e6a020104b.html)

Custom Name.description: Your defined name for your Cloud Integration account.

get.description: You can use the following request to get all deployed user credentials.

post.description:
You can use the following request to add user credentials.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to add user credentials.

parameters.name: UserCredential
parameters.description: User credentials which should be deployed
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

202.description: Accepted. Deployment triggered for user credentials

400.description: Bad request - request body does not contain the expected content.

message.value: An exception of type 'MalformedJsonException' occurred.

409.description: Conflict - user credentials with the same name already exists.

message.value: Entity with specified name already exists.

500.description: Internal server error - possibly wrong kind value is provided, must be one of [successfactors, default, openconnectors] or expected company Id for kind ```successfactors``` is missing or password does not match Open Connectors Credentials pattern, required pattern is : User \S{0,44},Organization \S{0,32},Element \S{0,44}

message.value: Password does not match Open Connectors Credentials pattern.

get.description: You can use the following request to get user credentials for a given credentials name.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
Name of the user credentials
Example: ```User ABC```

put.description:
You can use the following request to update user credentials.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update user credentials.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
Name of the user credentials
Example: ```User ABC```

parameters.name: UserCredential
parameters.description: New property values
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

202.description: Accepted. Deployment triggered for user credentials

400.description: Bad request - request body does not contain the expected content.

message.value: Entity key specified in URI does not match to name from payload.

409.description: Conflict - user credentials with specified name does not exist.

message.value: Entity with specified key does not exist.

500.description: Internal server error - possibly wrong kind value is provided -  must be one of [successfactors, default, openconnectors] or expected company Id for kind ```successfactors``` is missing or password does not match Open Connectors Credentials pattern - required pattern is : User \S{0,44},Organization \S{0,32},Element \S{0,44}

message.value: Password does not match Open Connectors Credentials pattern.

delete.description:
You can use the following request to delete user credentials.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to delete user credentials.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
Name of the user credentials
Example: ```User ABC```
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

get.description: You can use the following request to get all deployed secure parameters. The response body does not contain the values for the secure parameters. You can only store the values with the OData API, but you can't retrieve the values. This resource is only available in the Neo environment.

501.description: Not implemented - not implemented OData query parameters like $select or $filter.

message.value: $select is not supported.

post.description:
You can use the following request to add secure parameters.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to add secure parameters. This resource is only available in the Neo environment.

parameters.name: SecureParameter
parameters.description: Secure parameters to be deployed
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

202.description: Deployment triggered for secure parameters. Request was successfully accepted.

400.description: Bad request - request body is invalid. Examples: Name is null or empty, too long, or contains an invalid character; SecureParam is null, empty, or too long; description is null or too long; request body contains an invalid parameter.

message.value: Property 'SecureParam' must not be null.

409.description: Conflict - secure parameters artifact with the same name already exists.

message.value: Entity with specified name already exists.

get.description: You can use the following request to get secure parameters for a artifact name. This resource is only available in the Neo environment.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
Name of the secure parameters
Example: ```User ABC```

501.description: Not implemented - not implemented OData query parameters like $select or $filter.

message.value: $select is not supported.

put.description:
You can use the following request to update secure parameters.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update secure parameters. There are the following length restrictions: Name: 150 characters, SecureParam: 255 characters, Description: 1024 chacracters. This resource is only available in the Neo environment.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name of the secure parameters artifact. the name in the request path must be URL-encoded, the name in the request body is optional. If you specify it there as well, it must be equal to the name in the request path.

parameters.name: SecureParameters
parameters.description: Request body
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

202.description: Accepted. Deployment triggered for secure parameters

400.description: Bad request - request body is invalid. Name is null, empty, or too long, or contains an invalid character; name in the request body is not equal to the name in the request path (if the name is specified in the request body); SecureParam is null, empty, or too long; Description is null or too long; request body contains an invalid parameter.

message.value: Property 'SecureParam' must not be null.

409.description: Conflict - secure parameters artifact with specified name does not exist.

message.value: Entity with specified key does not exist.

delete.description:
You can use the following request to delete secure parameters.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to delete secure parameters. This resource is only available in the Neo environment.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
Name of the secure parameters
Example: ```User ABC```
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

put.description:
You can use the following request to import or update a certificate.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to add/update certificates.

parameters.name: Hexalias
parameters.description: Hex encoded value for certificate alias

parameters.name: CertificateResource
parameters.description: New certificate in byte format (only DER without PEM transport encoding!) or in DER with base64 encoding (without the PEM header and footer)

parameters.name: fingerprintVerified
parameters.description: Verify certificate signature.

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries in the response.

parameters.name: update
parameters.description: Update existing certificate.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/pkix-cert```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

results.SubjectDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU=Hana Cloud Integration, O=SAP, C=DE
CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE
results.IssuerDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE

204.description: No content. Success without content for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false```

400.description: Bad request - entry already exists for ```update=false``` or entry does not exists for ```update=true``` or certificate validation failed .

message.value: Keystore entry with alias "<alias>" already exists

403.description: Forbidden - either permission is missing or request alias is reserved for SAP (alias 'hcicertificate', 'hcicertificate1', 'hcimsgcertificate' or if alias has the prefix 'sap_')

409.description:
Conflict - Trust path to the certificate could not be established. The response error body contains the certificate as KeystoreEntry entity with the validity value 'notTrusted' in JSON-format.
You can check the fingerprint and can make again the request with the custom option ```fingerprintVerified=true```.

message.value: <error text>

413.description: Payload too large - request body is too large (maximum size is restricted to 10kB) or this certificate would exceed the maximum size of the keystore, which is restricted to 1 MB.

415.description: Unsupported media type - request body has the wrong format (correct formats are X.509 certificate in DER: binary format or with PEM textual encoding or with base 64 textual encoding)

503.description: Service unavailable - keystore is locked by another user.

get.description: You can use the following request to export a certificate for a certain alias (hex encoded value). If the specified alias represents a key pair, the certificate with the public key is exported.

parameters.name: Hexalias
parameters.description: Hex encoded value for certificate alias

parameters.name: keystoreName
parameters.description: Select the , from which the certificate chain shall be exported: Tenant keystore ```system```, the backup keystore ```backup_admin_system```, the renewal keystore ```KeyRenewal``` or the history keystore ```KeyHistory```.

parameters.name: rootCA
parameters.description: Provide root ca certificate for key pairs if existing.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/pkix-cert```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

message.value: hexBinary needs to be even-length: <hexalias>

post.description:
You can use the following request to generate a key pair.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to generate key pair.

parameters.name: KeyPairGenerationRequest
parameters.description: New entity

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries in the response.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/json;charset=utf-8```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: Success - all key store entries for ```returnKeystoreEntries=true```

results.SubjectDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU=Hana Cloud Integration, O=SAP, C=DE
CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE
results.IssuerDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE

204.description: No content. Success without content for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false```

400.description: Bad request - Keystore entry with the provided alias already exists or alias/common name is empty or null.

message.value: Keystore entry with alias "<alias>" already exists

413.description: Request entity too large - generated key pair would exceed the maximum size of the keystore, which is restricted to 1 MB.

message.value: <error text>

503.description: Service unavailable - keystore is locked by another user.

post.description:
You can use the following request to generate an RSA key pair.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to generate key pair.
As 'Hexalias', provide any hexadecimal value; the system calculates the correct hexadecimal value from the specified 'Alias' property.
Note the following regarding the 'RSAFile': If you're using a simple HTTP request with a JSON body, the value of the property 'RSAFile' must contain the base64-encoded private key with padding.
Possible values for 'SignatureAlgorithm' are 'SHA-512/RSA', 'SHA-256/RSA', 'SHA-384/RSA', 'SHA-224/RSA', 'SHA-1/RSA'.
For private keys, only PKCS#1 format with a PEM header 'BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY' is supported. This operation can only by performed on the 'system' keystore.

parameters.name: RSAKeyGenerationRequest
parameters.description: New entity

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries in the response.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/json;charset=utf-8```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: Success - all key store entries for ```returnKeystoreEntries=true```

results.SubjectDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU=Hana Cloud Integration, O=SAP, C=DE
CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE
results.IssuerDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE

204.description: No content. Success without content for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false```

400.description: Bad request - possible reasons: Keystore entry with the provided alias already exists; 'Alias', 'CommonName', or 'Country' is empty or null; invalid RSA file; RSA file is larger than 10000 bytes; 'SignatureAlgorithm' does not fit to the length of the key contained in the RSA file.

message.value: Keystore entry with alias "<alias>" already exists

413.description: Request entity too large - generated key pair would exceed the maximum size of the keystore, which is restricted to 1 MB.

423.description: Locked - keystore is locked by another user.

post.description:
You can use the following request to generate an SSH private key pair from an OpenSSH key (with cryptographic algorithms RSA, DSA or EC) or a PuTTY file (with cryptographic algorithms RSA or DSA, but not EC). The alias for the generated key pair depends on the algorithm: id_rsa, id_dsa or id_ec.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to generate key pair.

parameters.name: SSHKeyGenerationRequest
parameters.description: Base64 encoded file content

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries in the response.

parameters.name: update
parameters.description: Update existing SSH key pair.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/json;charset=utf-8```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: Success - alias in the response for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false``` or all keystore entries in the response for ```returnKeystoreEntries=true```

400.description: Bad request - entry with provided alias already exists for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false```; alias or common name is empty or null.

message.value: Keystore entry with alias "<alias>" already exists

403.description: Forbidden - either permission is missing or request alias is reserved for SAP (alias 'hcicertificate', 'hcicertificate1', 'hcimsgcertificate' or if alias has the prefix 'sap_')

413.description: Request entity too large - generated key pair would exceed the maximum size of the keystore, which is restricted to 1 MB.

message.value: <error text>

503.description: Service unavailable - keystore is locked by another user.

post.description:
You can use the following request to import or update a key pair.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to add/update key pair.

parameters.name: KeyPairResource
parameters.description: Key pair for import

parameters.name: fingerprintVerified
parameters.description: Verify signature of the top CA certificate.

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries in the response.

parameters.name: update
parameters.description: Update existing key pair.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/json;charset=utf-8```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

results.SubjectDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU=Hana Cloud Integration, O=SAP, C=DE
CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE
results.IssuerDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE

204.description: No content. Success without content for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false```

400.description: Bad request - entry already exists for ```update=false```, entry does not exists for ```update=true```, alias contains invalid character, certificate chain validation failed or password is not correct.

message.value: Keystore entry with alias "<alias>" already exists

403.description: Forbidden - either permission is missing or request alias is reserved for SAP (alias 'hcicertificate', 'hcicertificate1', 'hcimsgcertificate' or if alias has the prefix 'sap_')

409.description:
Conflict - Trust path to the top CA certificate could not be established. The response error body contains the certificate as KeystoreEntry entity with the validity value 'notTrusted' in JSON-format.
You can check the fingerprint and can make again the request with the custom option ```fingerprintVerified=true```.

413.description: Payload to large - request body is too large (maximum size is restricted to 30072 bytes) or this key pair would exceed the maximum size of the keystore, which is restricted to 1 MB.

415.description: Unsupported media type - resource property does not contain a PKCS#12 file.

503.description: Service unavailable - keystore is locked by another user.

get.description: You can use the following request to generate a certificate signing request.

parameters.name: Hexalias
parameters.description: Hex encoded value for key pair alias
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/pkcs10```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

put.description:
You can use the following request to import a certificate chain.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions for the keystore.

parameters.name: Hexalias
parameters.description: Hex encoded value for key pair alias

parameters.name: CertificateChainResource
parameters.description:
New certificate chain in one of the supported formats:
* PKCS#7 in binary or PEM or base 64 textual encoding
* chain of DER-PEM encoded X.509 certificates in one file
*  X.509 PKI path (sequence of certificates with top CA certificate at index 0)
* Software Publisher Certificate (SPC)

parameters.name: fingerprintVerified
parameters.description: Verify signature of the top CA certificate .

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries in the response.

HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set according to the certificate chain format: 
* ```application/pkcs7-mime``` for PKCS7
* ```application/x-pkcs7-certificates``` for SPC
* ```application/pkix-pkipath``` for PKIPath 
* no mime-type for chain of DER-PEM encoded X.509 certificates in one file.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

results.SubjectDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU=Hana Cloud Integration, O=SAP, C=DE
CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE
results.IssuerDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE

204.description: No content - success without content for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false```

400.description: Bad request - entry with provided alias does not represent key pair, certificate chain does not fit to the public key or certificate chain validation failed.

message.value: Alias "<alias>" does not represent a Key Pair

403.description: Forbidden - either permission is missing or request alias is reserved for SAP (alias 'hcicertificate', 'hcicertificate1', 'hcimsgcertificate' or if alias has the prefix 'sap_')

404.description: Not found - alias does not exist.

message.value: Alias '<alias>' not found in the keystore

409.description:
Conflict - Trust path to the top CA certificate could not be established. The response error body contains the certificate as KeystoreEntry entity with the validity value 'notTrusted' in JSON-format.
You can check the fingerprint and can make again the request with the custom option ```fingerprintVerified=true```.

413.description: Request body is too large (maximum size is restricted to 30072 bytes) or this added certificate chain would exceed the maximum size of the keystore, which is restricted to 1 MB.

415.description: Unsupported media type - request body has the wrong format (correct formats are PKCS7, SPC, PKIPath, Chain of DER-PEM encoded X.509 certificates).

503.description: Service unavailable - keystore is locked by another user.

put.description:
You can use the following request to rename entry alias of the current tenant keystore.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions for the keystore.
put.summary: Rename an entry alias of tenant keystore.

parameters.name: Hexalias
parameters.description: Hex encoded value for keystore entry alias

parameters.name: KeystoreEntry
parameters.description: Body needs to contain ```{"Status":null}```

parameters.name: renameAlias
parameters.description: URL encoded new alias name

parameters.name: returnHexAlias
parameters.description: Return HeaAlias (in square brackets) of the renamed entry in the response

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries in the response.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/json;charset=utf-8```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: Success - for ```returnHexAlias=true``` the new Hexalias value  (in square brackets) or for ```returnKeystoreEntries=true``` the all keystore entries

204.description: No content. Success without content - successfully renamed for```returnKeystoreEntries=false``` and ```returnHexAlias=false```

400.description: Bad request - entry with provided new alias already exists, custom query parameter ```renameHexAlias``` is missing or is empty/null or body content is invalid.

message.value: Keystore entry with alias "<alias>" already exists

403.description: Forbidden - either permission is missing or the new alias is reserved for SAP (alias 'hcicertificate', 'hcicertificate1', 'hcimsgcertificate' or if alias has the prefix 'sap_')

404.description: Not found - alias does not exist.

message.value: Alias '<alias>' not found in the keystore

503.description: Service unavailable - keystore is locked by another user.

delete.description:

In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions for the keystore.

parameters.name: keystoreName
parameters.description: Only relevant for activating an entry from the renewal keystore: ```KeyRenewal``` must be selected.

parameters.name: activate

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries

403.description: Forbidden - either permission is missing or request alias is reserved for SAP (alias 'hcicertificate', 'hcicertificate1', 'hcimsgcertificate' or if alias has the prefix 'sap_')

message.value: Alias '<alias>' not found in the keystore

get.description: You can use the following request to get keystore properties and entries.

parameters.description: Select the keystore, from which the certificate chain shall be exported: Tenant keystore ```system``` or the backup keystore ```backup_admin_system```.
HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept
$select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expand related entities.

200.description: Success - retrieved keystore properties and entries for $expand=Entries

results.SubjectDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU=Hana Cloud Integration, O=SAP, C=DE

get.description: You can use the following request to get the number of keystore entries.

parameters.name: KeystoreName
parameters.description: Select keystore: Tenant keystore ```system``` or the key renewal keystore ```KeyRenewal```.

200.description: Success - retrieved number of keystore entries.

400.description: Bad request - invalid keystore name. Only ```system``` and ```KeyRenewal``` are allowed.

message.value: Keystore name '<unsupported keystore>' is invalid.

post.description:
You can use the following request to import entries to the tenant keystore (target keystore name ```system```) or to back up the keystore entries owned by tenant administrator (target keystore name ```backup_admin_system```). For the import entries are ignored during import, which do not represent a X.509 certificate entry or a key pair entry with a certificate chain of X.509 certificates. The backup overwrites the old backup keystore.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to import the keystore entries.

parameters.name: Keystore
parameters.description:
Keystore for import or for backup:
* Name ```system``` resource with base64 encoded JKS or JCEKS and password for import
* ```{"Name": "backup_admin_system"}``` for backup.

parameters.name: importOption
parameters.description:
Only required for keystore import - must be deselected for backup. There are different options possible:
* ```replace``` - old keystore entries are deleted and imported entries are added.
* ```merge``` - only entries with new alias are added.
* ```overwrite``` - all entries are uploaded and possibly replace existing entries with the same alias.

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries with the import status in the response.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/json;charset=utf-8```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description:
Imported keystore entries for ```returnKeystoreEntries=true``` with the following status values:
```unchanged```,```changed```,```new```,```removed```,```notImported: An entry with the same alias already exists```, ```notImported: The alias is not allowed. Aliases starting with 'sap_' are reserved for SAP.```, ```notImported: The alias is not allowed. The alias 'hcicertificate' is reserved for SAP.```, ```notImported :Key Pair entry cannot be overwritten by a certificate entry.```

results.SubjectDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU=Hana Cloud Integration, O=SAP, C=DE
CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE
results.IssuerDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE

204.description: No content. Success without content for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false```.

400.description: Bad request - name property is not ```system``` for import or is not  ```backup_admin_system``` for backup or wrong import password or for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false``` at least one entry could not be imported and the complete import failed. The importOption ```merge``` is not recommended for returnKeystoreEntries ```false```

message.value: The value '<unsupported keystore>' is not supported for the property 'Name'. Possible name values are 'system' and 'backup_admin_system'.

413.description: Payload too large - maximum size or resource property is restricted to 1MB or resulting keystore would exceed the maximum size of 1 MB.

415.description: Unsupported media type - resource property does not contain JKS or JCEKS keystore.

503.description: Service unavailable - keystore is locked by another user.

get.description:
You can use the following request to export the public content of the keystore, which was created by SAP or tenant administrator.
For a private key entry the complete chain is exported as described in the following example: If the key pair entry has the alias ```test```, and has a chain of three certificates, the certificate of the entry gets the alias ```test``` in the exported keystore, the intermediate CA certificate gets the alias ```test_1```, and the root CA certificate gets the alias ```test_2```. If entries with ```test_1```or ```test_2``` already exist, an additional underscore ```_``` is added to the alias until it is unique.

parameters.name: KeystoreName
parameters.description: Select the keystore, from which the public content shall be exported: Tenant keystore ```system``` or the backup keystore ```backup_admin_system```.
HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

400.description: Bad request - invalid keystore name. Only ```system``` and ```backup_admin_system``` are allowed.

message.value: Keystore name '<unsupported keystore>' is invalid.

put.description:
You can use the following request to retrieve backed up keystore entries or to delete several entries of the current keystore, which are owned by tenant administrator.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions for the keystore.

parameters.name: KeystoreResource
parameters.description:
For retrieving backed up keystore entries ```{"Resource":null}``` must be entered.
For deletion of several keystore entries: List of aliases for the entries, which should be deleted, must be entered as ; seperated list. Specical characters ';','\' must be escaped. Example: The both aliases ```Company A; B``` and ```Company \ C \``` must be entered as ```Company A\; B;Company \\ C \\```.

parameters.name: retrieveBackup
parameters.description: Only for retrieving backed up keystore entries ```backup_admin_system``` must be selected. For deletion of several keystore entries this parameter is not relevant.

parameters.name: deleteEntries
parameters.description: Only for deletion of keystore entries ```true``` must be selected. For retrieving backed up keystore entries this parameter is not relevant.

parameters.name: importOption
parameters.description:
Only relevant for retrieving backed up keystore entries (default ```overwrite```). There are different options possible:
* ```replace``` - old keystore entries are deleted and imported entries are added.
* ```overwrite``` - all entries are uploaded and possibly replace existing entries with the same alias.

parameters.name: returnKeystoreEntries
parameters.description: Provide current keystore entries with the import status in the response.
HTTP header attribute Content-Type must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP header attribute Accept must be set to ```application/json```.
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description:
Success - all keystore entries for ```returnKeystoreEntries=true```.
For ```retrieveBackup=backup_admin_system``` the entries are provided with the following status values:
```unchanged```,```changed```,```new```,```removed```.
For ```deletedEntries=true``` this response code is also provided, if no keystore entries are deleted because of not found aliases.

results.SubjectDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU=Hana Cloud Integration, O=SAP, C=DE
CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE
results.IssuerDN: CN=sandbox.api.sap.com, OU="(c) 2008 VeriSign, Inc. - For authorized use only", OU=VeriSign Trust Network, O="VeriSign, Inc.", C=DE

204.description: No content. Success without content for ```returnKeystoreEntries=false```.

400.description: Bad request - keystore name is not ```system``` or request body is not provided in the expected format.

message.value: Keystore name '<unsupported keystore>' is invalid.

403.description: Forbidden - user permission is missing or for ```deletedEntries=true``` the alias list contains values, which are reserved for SAP (alias is equal with 'hcicertificate', is equal 'hcicertificate1', 'hcimsgcertificate' or alias has the prefix 'sap_')

404.description: Not found - no backed up keystore entries owned by tenant administrator. Only relevant for ```retrieveBackup=backup_admin_system```.

503.description: Service unavailable - keystore is locked by another user.

message.value: <error text>

put.description:
You can use the following request to restore an entry from the keystore history to the renewal keystore.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions for the keystore.
put.summary: Restore an entry from history to renewal keystore.

parameters.name: Hexalias
parameters.description: Hex encoded value for entry alias of the history keystore

parameters.name: KeystoreEntry
parameters.description: Body needs to contain ```{"Status":null}```

parameters.name: destinationAlias
parameters.description: URL encoded destination alias name (optional). If it is empty the new alias is provided in the form ```[number]_original alias```.

parameters.name: copy
parameters.description: Copy attribute must be ```true```
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

400.description: Bad request - destination alias already exists in renewal keystore or is not in the SAP namespace (alias 'hcicertificate', 'hcicertificate1', 'hcimsgcertificate' or with prefix 'sap_'), provided alias of the entry in the history keystore does not have the form ```[number]_original alias``` or invalid request body.

message.value: The alias "<unsupported alias>" is invalid: Alias '<unsupported alias>' does not start with '['

404.description: Not found - alias does not exist in history keystory.

message.value: Alias '<alias>' not found in the keystore

get.description:
You can use the following request to get all certificate-to-user mappings.This resource is only available in the Neo environment.
For more information, see SAP Help Portal documentation at [Environment-Specific Aspects Integration Developers Should Know](https://help.sap.com/docs/CLOUD_INTEGRATION/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/639a0612e32c498fa7480580d90c9ea6.html?locale=en-US).

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filter items only by user is supported.
Example: ```User eq 'supplier1'``` returns certificate mapping for the user 'supplier1'

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

post.description:
You can use the following request to add a new certificate-to-user mapping or to update the user of an existing mapping.

For more information, see SAP Help Portal documentation at [Environment-Specific Aspects Integration Developers Should Know](https://help.sap.com/docs/CLOUD_INTEGRATION/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/639a0612e32c498fa7480580d90c9ea6.html?locale=en-US).

Filter items by property values.
For any filter use only the 'eq' operator.
Example: ```RoleName eq 'AccessPolicy1'```.
Available properties for filter: Id, RoleName, Description

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values 'RoleName' and/or 'Id'.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Related artifact references to be returned.

post.description:
You can use the following request to add access policies. You can also create respective artifact reference in one call.
**ArtifactReference** - Following values of the *Type* property: 'MESSAGE_QUEUE' 'GLOBAL_DATA_STORE' 'GLOBAL_VARIABLE' have only one value for the property *ConditionAttribute*: 'Name' Check the ArtifactReference model for more values.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to add user credentials.

parameters.description: Example body to create access policy with artifact reference in one call
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').

message.value: An exception of type 'MalformedJsonException' occurred.

get.description:
You can use the following request to request the CSRF token for this session, which is required for write access via POST, PUT and DELETE operations. Copy the received X-CSRF-Token from the response header.
**In API sandbox this request is not relevant!**

parameters.description: To retrieve a new CSRF token the value of the header must be set to ```Fetch```.
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: The header provides the CSRF token for this session.

X-CSRF-Token.description: CSRF token that can be used for all modifying requests within the same session.

Resource.example: base64 encoded JKS or JCEKS keystore

Certificate.example: certificate in base64 encoded PEM-DER format

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items.

204.description: No content. The server successfully processed the request and is not returning any content

400.description: Bad Request. Wrong format or structure of the provided request body or parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Authorization information is missing or invalid.

403.description: Forbidden. The required permissions to access the resource are missing.

404.description: Not found. The requested resource could not be found.

409.description: Conflict. Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource.

429.description: Too many requests. Servers rate limit exceeded.

500.description: Internal server error. The requested operation led to an error during execution.

message.value: <error text>
